oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Induction certificate and photograph of John Blair
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Induction certificate and photograph of Pvt. John Blair, Co. G, 128th Inf. Regt., 32nd Div. Blair was from McMiinnville, Warren County, Tennessee and worked as a farmer before being drafted into the army in 1918. Blair was originally assigned to Co. A, 162nd Inf. Regt., 41st Div. However, the 41st never served as a unit in France and its men were used as replacements for other divisions. Blair received a slight wound on October 6, 1918 be recovered before being discharged at Fort Oglethorpe, Georgia.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Blair, John
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
